intro: Dictamnus altaicus, commonly known as the Siberian dictamnus, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its aromatic, often fragrant foliage. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. Its leaves are typically narrow and lance-shaped, with a distinctive, peppery scent when crushed. Dictamnus altaicus is often found in rocky or well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments.
